cards.description: Ahh, good ol' Rivayle. I know she's got her share of crooks, and most people 'round these parts don't have a pot to piss in, but I love her just the same! And after I catch me some bandits, she'll be an even nicer lady than she already is! Alrighty, Maiser—get your hiney on patrol!
cards.evo_description: I get it. I truly do. The world don't change just 'cause you ask nicely. But I love the people of this city, no matter their lot in life. And that's why you're comin' with me—Accelerate!

cards.evo_description: No matter how many times you freeze me, burn me, cut me, pierce me, or crush me, I shall only reappear in all my glory—at least until you finally figure out the trick.

cards.evo_description: Do not depend on their devotion, for that is not their purpose. To truly be a good fit for your familiar, you must work to improve yourself. Only then will your familiar's power increase. And wouldn't that be handy? —Familiars: An Introduction, Chapter 6

cards.evo_description: An explosion outside, you say? Ah, that must be Ms. Miranda. Just like when she was a student... Some things never change.

cards.evo_description: Your future's going to be all fwoosh and brrrr! Huh, don't you understand? Then hold on for a moment! I'll burn you—fwoosh—and freeze you—brrrr!

cards.evo_description: It's been years and years since I started learning magic. I'm still not a real mage, but someday I'll tell that girl just how I feel!

cards.evo_description: I won't let you run roughshod over the young ones' future. Never. Flee the academy while I am still me!

"Howdy! Pleasure to meetcha!"
"You guys are real... Right?"
cards.evo_description:
"I'm not sure if I'll ever be as good as her... But one day I want to be a great witch, just like Grandmother."
"That's the spirit, Anna!"
"But then again... it's too bright to go outside..."

cards.evo_description: If anything threatens the princess, I'll use all my knowledge and strength to defend her. With my enchanted blade, I can slice through any spell... Just try and stop me!

cards.description: Our way is truth. Yours is deception. Your true nature flutters in the depths of your soul. Call to it, release it, and achieve your purpose in life. Only then will the truth be revealed to you.
cards.evo_description:
The Third Rite: Understand Truth
Truth: the original desire. To act in accordance with this urge is but a law of life.
—Teachings of the Assembly of Truth

cards.evo_description: Sorcery is the way of righteousness—as long as you use your gift in the name of good, magic will always be your ally. So go on, then. Return to your colony with your newfound insight. —A fickle wizard

cards.evo_description: I was born to stand above all others! No matter where I go, I'm always number one! Cayman! Ready my handkerchief, as I have moved myself to tears!

cards.evo_description: The magical lifeform turned out splendidly thanks to the help of a strange machine. But a portion of mages objected against incorporating technology with magic. I imagine it will prove quite difficult to change their minds. —Comment about Magical Technology 2

cards.evo_description: And so God asked the king who bore fate on his shoulders: What is your wish? What is your desire? The king replied with one single word: Wisdom. Great wisdom, previously unknown to man. —The Founding Mage, Final Act

I mean, yeah, it's full of magical energy and whatever, but... Mine doesn't need to only work, it's gotta be efficient! See this? I only need an ounce of magic to get it working!
—Jetbroom Witch to Mechastaff Sorcerer

cards.description: Earth, fire, air, water—these are the four elements that combine to form our world. But within the eternal ebb of time, it seems humanity has forgotten its place. Heed these words: do not abandon old friends. For we are all threads in the fabric of the universe.
cards.evo_description: The artificial beast seeks out new enemies as a matter of function. It then coldly calculates the difference between itself and its target, devoid of mind or purpose. The struggle between the old ways and the new has begun.

cards.evo_description: The Magician is a vessel from which creation flows. Driven by the inexhaustible imperative for improvement, nothing can contain his conviction. He creates; therefore he is.

cards.description: There once was a young girl with boundless potential slumbering within. When she decided to divine for the world, her power burst forth, awakened. She is the diviner, and in her master's place, she will guide the people to a brighter future.
cards.evo_description: That crying girl of yesterday is no more. No matter how many times she stumbles, she'll keep getting up to fight despair. Destiny has taught her the most valuable lesson of all: how to stand on her own two feet.

cards.skill_disc: Fanfare: Summon a Dutiful Steed. Draw a card.
cards.org_skill_disc: [b]Fanfare[/b]: Summon a [b]Dutiful Steed[/b]. Draw a card.
cards.description:
"Read up, spring chicken. You're the newest piece of crap we've hired, which means you're responsible for upholding the law now. You best not ignore a single word of this handbook, you hear me?"
—Deputy's Handbook, First Page
cards.evo_description: "This whole town's a dung heap. And the criminals are the cattle doin' the dungin'. If you want to clean up the mess, you best forget everything you know about justice. Let's just hope you can stand the smell long enough to make a difference!" —Deputy's Handbook, Second Page

cards.description:
That thing in the periphery of my vision. Is it a light? A color? An afterimage? It matters not, for she will consummate me. Ah yes, I see it now—the truth of all magic.
—Soiled Scrap of Paper
cards.evo_description:
The light, color, and form remain vivid in my mind.
She filled every part of me—smashing me, thereby making me whole.
—Soiled Scrap of Paper

cards.description: Hyaa-ha-ha! Look at that thing burn! Huh? What are you doing here, brat? It's way past your bedtime. Keep giving me lip and I might roast you over a spit.
cards.evo_description: Hey, brat. I thought I told you to go home. Toddle onto bed, kiddo, or else you won't grow up big and strong. Y'know what? Never mind. It'll be faster if I walk you home myself.

cards.description: Twirl, leap, spin... Just like my teacher taught me, I pass this dance on to others, and so the craft evolves across the generations. Kind of a beautiful idea, isn't it? I wish my apprentices could see it that way! Why do they always run away from me?!
cards.evo_description: "I drill the steps into them until they’re ready to puke and cry!" "You’re going way too easy on them. They still have the energy to run away, don’t they?" "Right. You’re right! I’ve gotta stomp the spirit of the dance into them!" —Astral Dancer and Sun Oracle Pascale

cards.description:
This squirrel subsists mainly on mana stones. When hoarding, it sorts gems by type and grade. It is also proficient at appraising stones. This loveable pet is a source of great joy and utility.
—Mage's Monthly, Top 10 Magical Pets
cards.evo_description:
Of course the stones my pet squirrel sorts are eventually going to be used—those experiments won't conduct themselves—but the look she gives me every time I take a stone from her... I'm sorry. I'm so sorry...
—Magical Squirrel's Keeper

cards.description: The stars are always watching over us. They have a lot to teach us, and they protect us too—they're far kinder and wiser than the people down here. Hey, pipe down! Ugh, why do grown-ups fight all the time? You're so loud I can't hear what the stars are saying!
cards.evo_description: The sky is filled with stars. There are so many of them, but they all get along. Actually, I think they must be lonely—they're so close and yet so far away from each other. That's why grown-ups here are silly. You're right next to each other, but you can never get along!

cards.description: Our steelclad world ended abruptly. Its creator disappeared; everything came to a stop. Logically, I knew my chances for survival were minimal, but my heart still fought as frantically as any human's. As emotions roiled within me, the detestable chains of destiny unfurled.
cards.evo_description: The citizens, no longer bound to their sectors, restarted the factories. They gathered the precious resources within and shared them with us. Aiolon was crumbling, but because we worked together, we survived—until our sisters called us to that verdant world.

cards.description: Float like a cloud, flutter like a leaf. That is how a witch ought to stroll. Think of all the lovely things you'll miss if you just zoom past them on a broom. That's why I've chosen this parasol as my traveling companion.
cards.evo_description: The vast majority of witches get around on a broom, but I've never been one for racing or competition in general. If I'm going to get under an umbrella, I'd rather walk under my own than squeeze in with somebody else.

cards.description: Governance is all well and good, but I've got bigger concerns. Interdimensional beings started Isunia's conflict, so we must focus on preventing future incursions. Magis Covenant, reach beyond the blue! Repel any force that tries to destroy our land of shimmering dew!
cards.evo_description: When she told the citizens of Isunia her plans, they were taken aback. But there was one thing she didn't mention: if she could reach beyond this dimension, she could find her beloved friend. And as soon as she perfected her magic, Eleanor would go and meet her.

cards.description: There's more to experiments than researching grimoires. Isabelle said inspiration can come from everyday life, and I think I understand now. Fresh air does change one's perspective. As a matter of fact, this festival looks like the perfect place to absorb new ideas!
cards.evo_description:
"Get me one of those things on a stick, would you?"
"Hmm, they do look appetizing. I'll have one, too."
"Sigh... Maybe you two could try opening your own wallets for a change?"
—Guild Leaders

cards.evo_description: Kneading another color? It's all in your hands... Watch. Just add some blue while feeling blue and... Riven Earth!

cards.description: A magical lifeform that maintains order in the halls of Mysteria. Despite its fiery appearance, it’s a playful creature that has grown close with the student body.
cards.evo_description:
A new type of magical book known as a "smart tome" is catching on at Mysteria—and not only with students, but magical lifeforms as well.
"What's your user, Chandelian? I'll shoot you a follow!"
"Groo... Grooar!"

cards.evo_description:
Giving an amateur a broom is like pushing a chick out of its nest. They've gotta learn how to fly on their own and... Heh. Falling always knocks the brats down a peg or two.
—Experienced Witch

cards.evo_description:
Ah! There it is again... Someone is spying on me, despite my anti-scrying wards. And what technique they have! What a dark and devious spell.
—Mr. Heinlein, Shadow Mage

cards.description:
"My, what a lovely bluebird!" said Jenny the Joyful.
"Blue? The bird's red!" objected Mary the Mighty.
"No, it's green. See?" explained Stephie the Fortunate.
Lain followed each of their gazes to three unique birds.
cards.evo_description:
Jenny, with the blue bird's wisdom, wrote the first grimoire. Mary, with the red bird's courage, blazed the mages' trail. Stephie, with the green bird's love, taught many pupils.
—Lain and the Fledgling Sages, Seventh Edition

cards.description:
A place like this could only exist far from the city... Clean, quiet, and a even a little luxurious despite the cost. And look at all those books—it's like having my very own library! Perhaps that owl is the librarian?
—Memory of Guest 10,101
cards.evo_description:
"The owl was gracious enough to let me borrow some books! I was surprised to discover so many interesting books I'd never seen before!"
The woman looked ecstatic—I could tell she meant it.
—Excerpt from "The Wise Woman" (For Reference Only)

cards.description: Spirits are born in many ways, but you're quite special, aren't you? Gathering so much magic that you discarded your physical body... But don't worry. I can still hear you.
cards.evo_description: To protect your friends, you say? How selfless of you. But you can rest easy now. Lend me your strength, spirit, and I'll see to it that your friends are kept safe from harm.

cards.description:
Birds of a feather flock together. In other words, befriend a bird, and you will be one of the flock. Aspiring mages, if you would soar to greater heights, seek out the sage of the wood.
—Beginner's Guide to Familiars, Chapter 1
cards.evo_description:
Displaying one's wisdom, especially among the uninitiated, is bound to ruffle some feathers. Sharing wisdom in the company of your flock, however, fosters collegiality.
—Beginner's Guide to Familiars, Chapter 6

cards.description: I've had me a good, long life full of adventure, duels, and too many trials and triumphs to count. All that's left is to enjoy my golden years. Sigh... but that's easier said than done.
cards.evo_description: You're an interesting whippersnapper. Take it from an old man: you'll face your share of tribulations before you head off into the sunset, but you'll have plenty of fun along the way, just like me!

cards.evo_description: I've reevaluated my thinking, and realize that maid work and student council work are two sides of the same coin. I will wield this broom as I would a wand and make this academy sparkle!

Hehe, oh my, did I strike a nerve?
—Shion Otosaka
cards.evo_description:
It's much better to live behind an avatar if you fear being despised by others. After all, an avatar can't be hurt...
—Shion Otosaka

Listen closely—this is something that everyone should know. Shadowverse is fun. It's exhilarating. But it's also... unforgiving.
—Shinobu Miki
cards.evo_description:
We've reached this battle's finale, new kid. With the twinkling stars as our guide, go forth, Astrological Sorcerer!
—Shinobu Miki

cards.description:
When I was young, I dissected a chicken—and its chicks. They were kept as pets at the academy. I wanted to see what made them tick. My technique was perfect, but the head doctor chastised me—"First, do no harm," he said.
—Cleansing Grounds: Memories of a Convict, Part 1
cards.evo_description:
It was only after I left the academy and found employment that I realized my ineptitude. My sister accused me of neglecting my work. She said I'd made hypotheses, but failed to prove them.
—Cleansing Grounds: Memories of a Convict, Part 2

cards.description:
When I next saw my sister, she lay on her deathbed. Despite being a seasoned doctor, she could do nothing—"Incurable," they said. She begged me to help her. Is this what it means to care? To be human?
—Cleansing Grounds: Memories of a Convict, Part 3
cards.evo_description:
"What's wrong with you?!" "We aren't animals! You can't treat us like this!" "You're unhinged... Inhuman!" I don't understand. What is more human than endeavoring to save one's family?
—Cleansing Grounds: Memories of a Convict, Part 4

cards.description: Her innocent curiosity led her into the dark unknown. Her peers feared her—shunned her—and soon there was nowhere left for her to go but deeper. She reached a tiny hand up, pulling a locked tome down off the shelf.
cards.evo_description: Before she'd finished undoing the buckle, the tome threw itself open. Flames writhed forth from the pages, coalescing into a figure. It took a knee, bowing its head to the girl. Many worlds had it devoured, but never had it seen hunger for knowledge like hers.

cards.description:
As the ash settled and the colorful light faded, the Leonardian Provost, Gruinne, stepped forward.
"It would be a shame to end the night so soon. Allow me to contribute a spell of my own."
—Mysteria and Leonard's Magic Mixer, Part 8
cards.evo_description:
Gruinne cast a circle of magic over the party—but it was devoid of any runes or glyphs. She grinned at the bewildered students, and motioned the Mysterian prodigy Anne forward. "Care to help me?"
—Mysteria and Leonard's Magic Mixer, Part 9

The djinn said it could grant the man only a limited number of wishes. So the man wished for unlimited wishes. Since then their lives have been inextricably linked, and quite the strange duo they make.

The man wished to bring peace to a troubled world. The djinn had never before encountered a human with wishes so selfless. Without realizing, they had begun to act as one. Their names spoken throughout the three realms.
—Ten Thousand and One Nights, Night 774

The elementalists chose their path. They would cut ties from the foul machinists and act as wardens for all creation. Humanity's purpose, after all, was to live alongside nature—not to control it.
—Magica Principia, Part 3

cards.evo_description:
That feeling when you think the deadline's ages away, only to find it's long passed? Yes, I know that feeling all too well...
—Ghostwriter

cards.description: I used to carry a crystal ball everywhere back when I was still a fortune-teller. But seeing all the tragic fates that lie ahead just made me blue...
cards.evo_description: This crystal sword's my best friend now. And it's what I'll use to carve my own path toward the future. That's right—by acting rather than seeing, I'm taking responsibility for my own destiny.

cards.description:
"The fact that you've read this far shows you take this job seriously. Listen—if you plan on sticking it out in this stinkin' hellhole, I've got your back. I'll keep you safe till you're able to hold your own."
—Magical Gunslinger's Diary, Page 5
cards.evo_description:
"Seriously, this job is total bullcrap. It sure as hell ain't worth dying for, especially not for a straight arrow like you. Why don't you go sip on some milk while I clean up the mess here?"
—Magical Gunslinger's Diary, Page 6

cards.description: All right, apprentices, open up your books and pay attention! The path of the mage is the path to true wisdom. I'm expecting great things from all of you, but we need to give you a thorough grounding in the basics first.
cards.evo_description: All right, everybody outside! Book learning will only get you so far. You have to put that knowledge to practical use if you want to make any worthwhile discoveries.

cards.description: If the going gets tough, you can count on me! After all, I'm the strongest mage in the sky and I can help out lots! Now that that's done... Did I do a good job? Tell me what a good job I've done!
cards.evo_description: I can deal with bad guys like, "Pow!" But healing magic puts a smile on everybody's faces, and that's why my magic's the best! Tell me if you have an owie and I'll make it all better, okay?

cards.skill_disc: Fanfare: Put a Resentful Blaze into your hand. Banish 2 random cards from your deck. If you had 20 cards or less in your deck before the cards were banished, gain +3/+3.
cards.org_skill_disc: [b]Fanfare[/b]: Put a [b]Resentful Blaze[/b] into your hand. Banish 2 random cards from your deck. If you had 20 cards or less in your deck before the cards were banished, gain +3/+3.
cards.evo_skill_disc: Evolve: Recover 2 play points. Banish 2 random cards from your deck.
cards.org_evo_skill_disc: [b]Evolve[/b]: Recover 2 play points. Banish 2 random cards from your deck.
cards.description: Friends? What a joke. You don't get it. You're so strong and true, it makes me want to tear you open and scoop out your insides. You dazzled me when you took my hand and led me out of that tower. My brilliant and cruel Anne... You should know, I've always hated you!
cards.evo_description: I shut myself away, terrified of being different. You walked in the sunlight, smiling at everyone. You said we could both bloom here, no matter our differences. Don't... Don't try to understand me. I never asked you to. Please, just disappear from my sight. Just die, Anne!

cards.skill_disc: Fanfare: Put a random Runecraft follower (excluding Pyrotechnic Witch) from your deck into your hand. If you have 20 cards or less in your deck, put 2 different Runecraft followers into your hand instead and subtract 1 from their costs.
cards.org_skill_disc: [b]Fanfare[/b]: Put a random Runecraft follower (excluding [b]Pyrotechnic Witch[/b]) from your deck into your hand. If you have 20 cards or less in your deck, put 2 different Runecraft followers into your hand instead and subtract 1 from their costs.
cards.description: Bang, pow, boom! Ooh, those explosions send a shiver down my spine! Huh...? Is that cannon fire, you ask? Nope! My magic is all about bringing peace to everyone. When you see a firework bloom in the night sky, it just takes the thorns out of your heart, doesn't it?
cards.evo_description: Sound and light don't equal fireworks. You need the pow-pow-power of the explosion! That's why I use my pyrotechnic magic—to blast away the negative energy! Let each bang take a load off your heart! Let each boom lift your sinking spirits into the sky!

cards.skill_disc: Fanfare: Put a Rending Blast into your hand. Banish 2 random cards from your deck. If you had 20 cards or less in your deck before the cards were banished, summon an Anne's Summoning.
cards.org_skill_disc: [b]Fanfare[/b]: Put a [b]Rending Blast[/b] into your hand. Banish 2 random cards from your deck. If you had 20 cards or less in your deck before the cards were banished, summon an [b]Anne's Summoning[/b].
cards.evo_skill_disc: Evolve: Deal 2 damage to an enemy. Restore 2 defense to your leader. Banish 2 random cards from your deck.
cards.org_evo_skill_disc: [b]Evolve[/b]: Deal 2 damage to an enemy. Restore 2 defense to your leader. Banish 2 random cards from your deck.
cards.description: Let the academy crumble to dust—there are too many memories here. I loved you—you were precious to me. I thought we were the same! We were both cursed with too much strength and stood alone—that's why I took your hand! But you betrayed me, Grea. I'll never forgive you!
cards.evo_description: I thought we had a lot in common despite our different forms and positions. I thought we could stand together, understand each other. Liar. Liar. You big liar! You were deceiving me all along. I'll blast you to smithereens with my magic. This is where you die, Grea!

cards.skill_disc: Fanfare: If you have more than 20 cards in your deck, banish 2 random cards from your deck. Otherwise, restore 4 defense to your leader.
cards.org_skill_disc: [b]Fanfare[/b]: If you have more than 20 cards in your deck, banish 2 random cards from your deck. Otherwise, restore 4 defense to your leader.
cards.description: In an age where customers have so many medical options, why should you take something that tastes awful? Buuuut, my potions aren't fruit juice either. They're just as—if not more—potent than regular medicines, and if you overdo it...
cards.evo_description: Drinking the potion straight up is fine, but I recommend pouring it over the rocks and pairing it with a nice, juicy steak. Just make sure not to drink too much, or you'll regret it in the morning.

cards.description: For the first time in our history, we're sharing the fruit of our research with the public: lifeforms to supplement the workforce and teleportation magic to help people get around... I don't know if you can call our work noble, but it still feels great to do our part.
cards.evo_description: It was Eleanor who decided we needed to be part of Isunia's restoration: "You can learn as much from the world outside as you can from grimoires." Oh, you misunderstand; I don't disagree. It's just... the look on her face... she's really changed for the better, you know?

cards.description: There is a quivering in my inner gears that feels like warm rain. This emotion tells me that something better is waiting for us in this world. We no longer have to fight... We are free to find happiness. I am eager to start a new life among our new friends.
cards.evo_description: Lol, you crack me up, Sapphire. That "quivering in your inner gears" is probs the same feeling I get when I'm caught up in a sudden squall. Like, you're ecstatic and want to jump in all the puddles? Yeah, that's definitely happiness you’re feelin', babe.

cards.description: Driven by grief, she experimented with the taboo. The world was too big and cold without him. She reached for magic not found in any tome. Perhaps she would find something to fill the void. The world and the mage went on, running in parallel, if not in tandem.
cards.evo_description: Come to think of it, I've wandered far from my original goal. Is death something to be tampered with? Maybe it's time I accepted this pain. I'm still looking for answers, and I don't know where I'm going next, but I'll find my way with everybody's help!

cards.description: The town will be all smiles when I'm done! One coin, one smile! (Blergh. Great. A kid? This ain't a charity, you know?) Well, aren't you just adorable! What can I do you for? (Whatever... just get it over with quickly.)
cards.evo_description:
Oh, no! Picking on kids, now? How pathetic of you! (I'm here to bring smiles with my magic!)
You'll do as I say once we're through—every last one of you! (Wickedness begone!)

cards.evo_description: The Ten Omens were returned to the world on a tablet of sapphire stone. Carved into a new column was the next Trial of Truth—Elimination. Disciples once more laid ruin to cities, reinstituting the undisputable laws of nature.

cards.evo_description: Today, one of its ■■■■ fell off, but it doesn't s■■m phased. It just sits there, watc■■ng me. It hasn't been eat■■g, so I'm going to ■■ in and check on it. —Battered Journal of Missing Wizard

cards.evo_description: The new and improved acid golem is doing great! Most monsters won't even go near it, and it's been e■■ing the ones that do. I wasn't sure if I should let it, but it seems stro■■■■ ■han ever. —Damaged Page in Wizard's Journal

With my food and lodging being looked after, I can focus on my literature. And with this symphony, my thoughts are as clear as ever. I've been asked for another interview tonight as well.
—Memory of Guest 200,040
cards.evo_description:
"Only true literature has soul. And I mean that in every sense of the word."
He claimed that my writing had it as well. We got along famously, and our conversation went deep into the night.
—Excerpt from "The Eternal Guest" (For Reference Only)

cards.evo_description: Grr... D-don't get the wrong idea! I'm only putting destroying the world on pause for now, okay? I'm totally not giving up or anything like that!

cards.evo_description: If innate talent decided everything, the angels would have naught to teach mortalkind. By applying themselves to the study of the arcane arts and grappling with the unknown, people bloom, coming into their fullest potential.

cards.description: "With a twirl of my staff, a miracle is born!" In the mere blink of an eye, calamity and misery are both undone. "And now, naughty lambs who would mess up these lands need to be punished!" And thus began the benevolent reign of the Miracle Sorceress.
cards.evo_description: "Did I... did I really... do it?" She'd rid the town of its demon problem—by wiping the town from existence. The sorceress's smile froze on her face. "One more miracle, then. 'Memoria extermina!' Buh-bye now!" And thus ended the benevolent reign of the Miracle Sorceress.

-During your turn, whenever an allied follower's attack or defense is increased by an effect, put X Words of Judgments into your hand (up to 3 per turn). X equals the number of followers whose attack or defense was increased by that effect.
-Whenever you play a spell, if it's the 3rd, 6th, 9th, 12th, 15th, or 18th spell of the same name you've played this match, deal 3 damage to all enemies.
(These effects are not stackable and last for the rest of the match.)

[b]Evolve[/b]: Give your leader the following effects.
-During your turn, whenever an allied follower's attack or defense is increased by an effect, put X [b]Words of Judgment[/b][b]s[/b] into your hand (up to 3 per turn). X equals the number of followers whose attack or defense was increased by that effect.
-Whenever you play a spell, if it's the 3rd, 6th, 9th, 12th, 15th, or 18th spell of the same name you've played this match, deal 3 damage to all enemies.
(These effects are not stackable and last for the rest of the match.)
cards.description: The Titan of Order is true to his title. He's the heavy hand of the law, a fair tyrant that keeps the criminal element of Rivayle in check. Better to obey the Peacekeeper than be commanded by his words.
cards.evo_description:
"Order, justice... Y'all see any of that 'round here? I suppose, given his proclivities, one might say he's a thrall to such lofty ideals. What he don't understand is this: the world would break itself if it knew it could make a dime."
—Iceschillendrig, Gilded Autocrat

cards.skill_disc: Fanfare: Put a random Runecraft spell from your deck into your hand.
cards.org_skill_disc: [b]Fanfare[/b]: Put a random Runecraft spell from your deck into your hand.
cards.description: A summoning circle is the epitome of freedom. It must therefore be drawn by hand. If your heart is true, so too shall be your circle. A ruler is nothing but a crutch—snap it and free yourself from restraint!
cards.evo_description: A summoning circle is a work of art. It flows freely, unburdened by prescriptive form. If your heart is flexible, the circle will draw itself. Break the compass and free yourself from its tyranny!

cards.description: Coiled within a double helix are the building blocks of life. Under normal circumstances, grafting two entirely different species is unthinkable, but my wand makes absurdities realities. Now, then... Which lovey-dovey specimens should I pair up next?
cards.evo_description: Life is a work in progress, just as the universe intended. By joining two disparate quantities, I am creating a new X factor. The perfection of life is the essence, nay, the raison d'être, of all mages.

To speak with, interview, and write about a guest is not enough. One's soul can only be reached when a work is finished, as the true self is found between the lines.

cards.description: Peace, harmony, and tranquility are all we need. War is but a futile and meaningless endeavor. Bloodstained warriors, won't you stay and listen to the words of this old man?
cards.evo_description: It may seem like an impossible dream, but there is merit in striving for peace. Is wanting a world without conflict so wrong? If you won't listen to my words, perhaps I shall show you!

cards.description:
There is beauty in inevitability. But beauty and truth are very different things. Those seemingly forged of happenstance still play their part in the greater, unchanging design.
—Chapter 4, On Golems
cards.evo_description:
Third-rate mages rely on chance.
Second-rate mages try to eliminate it.
Only when you learn to control chance can you call yourself a first-rate mage.
—Chapter 5, On Golems

cards.description: Most mages are endowed with a natural inquisitiveness. Some view the vulnerable nature of a mortal body as a problem—one they undertake to remedy.
cards.evo_description: Some mages who fuse with the demons they summon lose their minds. Others can master their new demonic bodies and retain their reason. The difference between the two is paper-thin and lies, perhaps, in that inquisitive spirit.

cards.skill_disc: Fanfare: Put a Mysterian Knowledge into your hand.
cards.org_skill_disc: [b]Fanfare[/b][b]:[/b] Put a [b]Mysterian Knowledge[/b] into your hand.
cards.description: As your re-elected class president, I'd like to make a pledge! Let's join forces to help shape this academy into an even more splendid place to learn! I know we can do it together!
cards.evo_description: Sure the classrooms get blown up sometimes, and students fly through the air... But that's just another part of Mysteria Academy's charm. As class president, I will ensure this academy retains that charm into the next era!

cards.description: Core mutations have led to one new optimization after another. Arcane sorcerers can be divided into two groups: practitioners of the arts, and theorycrafters. Mechanized lifeforms fall in a unique space, as they are both. —Research Archives of the Sorcerer's Guild, Vol. 2
cards.evo_description:
A new type of magical life-form... As a product, I suppose it is definitely marketable, but the logic behind such a creation needs to be checked out. I think I can provide a more... graceful solution.
—Mechabook Sorcerer to a Mechanized Lifeform

cards.description: Ignorance. I won him the golden fleece. I stepped aboard the Argo. I, who foolishly, foolishly gave over my heart, now cling to the rail of this narrow ship, as the currents toss me. That was my ignorance.
cards.evo_description: Destiny. I shall burn Glauce. I will abandon Iolcus. You, wretched, wretched lover, shall grow dizzy in my embrace. This was always our destiny.

Just as Onmyodo is on the verge of dying out, a new torchbearer appears. He learns all there is to know about the forces of yin and yang and summons powerful shikigami.
—The Legacy of Onmyodo: Zai
cards.evo_description:
Nobles and peasants alike are nothing before the shikigami. Onmyodo makes a name for itself once again, spreading throughout the world.
—The Legacy of Onmyodo: Zen

cards.description:
O flowing, mutable water, master of gentle change and of conservation. Strengthen the essence of conservation, and become ice. Oh, just be careful not to freeze too much.
—Riley, Hydroshaman
cards.evo_description:
We make use of the four elements through spirit mediums. However, these arts, the oldest of all magics, are currently under new threat. This is in no small part due to the steel uprising and its perversion of natural phenomena.
—Magica Principia, Part 1

cards.description: I'm not actually fond of sweets, you know. If anything, I find them too saccharine for my taste. But the morsels they attract? Why, they're so adorable I could gobble them up. Now how about a nice toffee, my little cream puff?
cards.evo_description: The more treats I conjure, the more they gather. Ahh, just look at them. With every bite their pink cheeks grow rounder. Ooh, they really are adorable. But... they've been eating for hours. Surely they've had more than enough?

She does amazing work, just oozing with creativity. Though I'll admit she's not exactly the nicest person. First time I met her, she actually said I've got the face of a lizard. Ugh, the nerve.
—Peddler of Magic Paintings
cards.evo_description:
Dancing stars, floating castles, flying fish—she has a real flair for the fantastical. Thing is, she even does pieces on reptiles sometimes. Whenever I tell her those are hard to sell, she somehow takes that as a compliment.
—Peddler of Magic Paintings

cards.evo_description: Hee-hee... Ametrine, rose quartz, tiger's eye... So many beautiful stones, and I can write them all off as research expenses. I love being a witch!

cards.description: Incantations and spell books, is that all magic means to you? I suggest you let go of those preconceptions. Just as water is more valuable than gold in the middle of the desert, the real solution to the mysteries of the universe is all a matter of perspective.
cards.evo_description: The mind is what assigns meaning and purpose to the world around us. Without us, all is random chaos. If you have the will, your mind can create something from nothing. That is the true miracle of magic.

cards.org_skill_disc: [b]Fanfare[/b]: Put 2 [b]Electrokitties[/b] into your hand.
cards.description: Ah, my precious kitty familiars! I could just pet them and bury my face in their floof all day! They don't listen to a word I say and just kind of sleep all day... But that's what makes them so charming!
cards.evo_description:
Our servant's pats are all right and her brushing technique gets a passing grade. She's kinda slow and not really that great at magic... But I suppose that's part of her charm, meow.
—Cat Familiars

cards.description: Gaze into this prism, and it shall guide your way. Now, what do you see? Worry not, for there is no wrong path—just as each person has a wavelength all their own, there is a path that's yours to walk. Rejoice in the richness that is your life.
cards.evo_description: Does the unknown frighten you? Ah, but you see, there is no such thing as a right way. Refractions are a part of light and life. Worrying is fine; but know that life is filled with twists and turns. At the end of your journey lies happiness, so enjoy each step of the way.

They say it's important to keep knowledge alive. Well, I've done just that with this tome!
—Wizened Wizard
cards.evo_description:
"Knowledge can make prideful beasts of us; take care that it does not devour you." Oh, that’s good to know—I just wish the old coot had told me that before I opened this book!
—Well-Bitten Young Wizard

Reject your emotions and hypotheses. If something cannot be quantified and proven factual, it is by all logic false.
...I have accepted the truth, as should you.
cards.evo_description: The Ten Omens were bestowed upon the world on a tablet of sapphire stone. Upon the trials' completion, the stone crumbled, but devoted disciples of truth embraced the Assembly's knowledge, even as they burned their books.

cards.evo_description: Learning its master was no more permanent than itself, the golem lashed out at anything and everything, blinded by runs of rime melting from its eyes.

cards.evo_description: All humans lie, because any attempt to distill nature into isolated, parsable "facts" inevitably fails to represent the full picture. Yet that has long been an established truth among the initiated. (Lies are mercies to shield people from harsh truths. Duh.)

cards.evo_description: ...I see. A very impressive magic trick indeed. You must've worked hard. Unfortunately it seems you're blissfully unaware of one thing—real lightning always strikes the highest target!

cards.evo_description: It's high time you moved on from waving your wand and drawing circles. So much effort, when magic is meant to be quite simple. Now, sit down and just let the magic happen.

cards.evo_description: Mysteria is where Grea was first accepted for who she really was. As they run to save their beloved academy, Grea glances at the light of her life, knowing that together, they will prevail. "You got it, Anne. We'll protect the academy with everything we've got!"

After the invocation was complete, the two spirits spoke: "Only one of us may you subjugate to your will. Which power do you desire?" The mage lowered their gaze and replied, "In two there are one; and in one, there are two."
—Of Flame and Tide, Chapter 1
cards.evo_description:
Spirits are not bound to any fixed form. The two may look distinct, but they are in fact one. Do not be fooled by appearances—the truth lies beneath. The mage realized this, and carved a name for himself with his new power.
—Of Flame and Tide, Chapter 2

cards.description: Come hither and hearken well. The sound of my shackles shattering heralds the beginning of the end.
cards.evo_description: With rebirth comes metamorphosis. Pity none shall be left to see it once my rapturous flames have scorched this earth.

cards.description: The unknown exists within the known. How long has it been since I last set foot in this land? One must consider the past to uncover the future... And as I am now, I am confident that I am capable of doing just that.
cards.evo_description: By refining the known, one can discover the unknown. The quest for knowledge is never-ending. Constant effort will yield success.

cards.description:
The young one toiled over what to build his golem of for so long, I couldn't help but drop a hint—and "accidentally" spilled some ice water on the lad.
—A Sorcerer's Journal
cards.evo_description:
I was brainstorming ideas for my golem when Master dumped a glass of freezing water on me. Argh, I'm still so... Hang on. I could freeze water!
—An Apprentice's Journal

cards.description: Open your mouth wide and breathe through your diaphragm. Remember, enunciation is the key—muddled words will muddle the magic. That's why I'm singing... If it means keeping my magic from running amok, I'll try anything!
cards.evo_description: In a corner of Mysteria, a blob of magic began to form. But just as the eldritch beast materialized, a dreadful wailing pierced the air. The song filled the beast with such existential dread that it vanished on the spot. And so, unknown to all, the academy was saved.

cards.description:
The zodiac is in a perfect but delicate balance, which could be swayed at any time by forces beyond our control. It is not absolute—do not take it for granted.
—A Guide to Onmyodo: Mysteries
cards.evo_description:
(Tch, idiots. You can't trust anyone but yourself—and that which is proven false... must be eliminated.)
—Kuon, Wuxing Master

cards.description: The true path forward is clear; no tutelage is needed to see it. Reject depravity, abhor cruelty, do no harm. This much is obvious to any human... save you. Your soul is far too sullied to understand. I, Simael, the Fifth Enforcer, will purify your wicked soul.
cards.evo_description: You must be made to see your sinful nature. To relearn what is moral. Your inhuman experimentation—hacking, sawing, slicing away at flesh—it is deplorable. I need not hear your pretext. Your deeds are vile, and your soul cries out for purification.

cards.description:
Studying, tests... If it required brainpower, I was always number one. But Shadowverse was different. The key word being—was.
—Kai Ijuin
cards.evo_description:
No matter how many attempts it takes, I won't stop trying.
No matter what happens, I won't yield.
I'll press forward, even in the face of adversity!
Now, turn back the hands of time! Chrono Witch!
—Kai Ijuin

cards.description:
I never thought that I'd be accepted by a bunch like you. Everyone's always avoided me... I thought I'd be better off remaining alone.

cards.evo_description:
My strategy is perfect! My defenses impenetrable! You are no match for me! And now, the strongest monarch comes forth to rule the day! Mystic King!
—Shion Otosaka

I command the five elements. (You're finished.)

I command the five elements. (You're finished.)

cards.description: After they saw their creation shake the earth, call the rain, stoke new fire, and summon old wind, the machinists rejoiced. They had created a being that could subjugate nature itself—never mind the magical perversion it left in its wake to do so.
cards.evo_description:
Gaian crown, aquan claws, flamen tail, aeroan horns... It's composed of the same elements as we. To pervert creation is folly, and I shall teach you of your ignorance, foolish cretins.
—Uhlein, Grand Magus

cards.description: By the light of the first star descended a second revelation: Come it thrice or four times again, judge not man's oft-repeated folly. Give naught but as oft-repeated forgiveness. The prophetess bowed her head, pledging her five senses to the gods.
cards.evo_description: On the gods' six-sided checkerboard, she was the seventh piece. Buffeted by the advent of eight disasters, movements of rival players, she wove her way around the board guided by the flickering light of nine planets. Reaching the other side at last, she was kinged tenfold.
